DOC.brief_summary: This study aims to determine changes in cerebral blood flow of people with obesity after the ingestion of fat.
DOC.brief_title: Ingestion of Lipids and Changes in Cerebral Blood Flow of People With Obesity
DOC.criteria: Live in Ribeirão Preto, São Paulo Brazil. Regular menses. Weight inferior than 120 Kg and body mass index (BMI) between 30 and 40 kg/m2, for the group with obesity. BMI between 18,5 and 24,9 kg/m2, for the group without obesity. High blood pressure, diabetes, glucose intolerance or impaired fasting glycemia, metabolic syndrome, hypothyroidism and any kidney, liver, heart or neurologic disease. Psychiatric disorders, alcoholism, smoking or illicit drug abuse. Pregnancy or desire to be pregnant Use of medications, excluding contraceptives. Contraindication for magnetic resonance imaging. Be in treatment for obesity.
